title: CORD SYSTEM
introduction: As in all martial arts, capoeira has its own graduation system. The level reached by students is indicated by the color of their belt ("corda"). ABADÁ-Capoeira has two main systems: the Children's System (Graduação Infantil) organized by age, and the Adult System (Graduação Adulto) organized by skill level.

ageGroups.title: Sistema de Graduação Infantil
ageGroups.description: The Children's Graduation System is organized by age, from 2 years old through 17 years old. Each age group receives a specific cord that recognizes their development and progress in capoeira.

cords.name: 2 e 3 anos
cords.meaning: Beginning of the capoeira journey for the youngest students

cords.name: 4 anos
cords.meaning: Developing basic coordination and rhythm

cords.name: 5 anos
cords.meaning: Learning fundamental movements

cords.name: 6 anos
cords.meaning: Building discipline and respect

cords.name: 7 anos
cords.meaning: Strengthening ginga and basic kicks

cords.name: 8 anos
cords.meaning: Preparing for transition

cords.name: 9 anos
cords.meaning: First major transition cord

cords.name: 10 anos
cords.meaning: Gold represents dedication to practice

cords.name: 11 anos
cords.meaning: New cycle - building on foundations

cords.name: 12 anos
cords.meaning: Growing awareness and enthusiasm

cords.name: 13 anos
cords.meaning: The sun reflects growing enthusiasm

cords.name: 14 anos
cords.meaning: New cycle begins - awareness of the journey

cords.name: 15 anos
cords.meaning: Transformation toward maturity

cords.name: 16 anos
cords.meaning: Preparing for transition to adult system

cords.name: 17 anos
cords.meaning: The sea - ready for adult graduation

ageGroups.title: Sistema de Graduação Adulto
ageGroups.description: The Adult Graduation System encompasses the full ABADÁ-Capoeira progression, from beginner (Aluno) through the highest level of mastery (Grão Mestre).

cords.name: Corda Crua
cords.meaning: Corda Crua Iniciante - The beginning of the adult capoeira journey

cords.name: Corda Crua-Amarelo
cords.meaning: Transformação - Developing fundamental skills and technique

cords.name: Corda Amarelo
cords.meaning: O Ouro (Gold) - Signifies the value of the learning that will be developed

cords.name: Corda Amarelo-Laranja
cords.meaning: Transformação - Growing awareness and technique refinement

cords.name: Corda Laranja
cords.meaning: O Sol (The Sun) - Signifies the awakening of the apprentice's consciousness

cords.name: Corda Laranja-Azul
cords.meaning: Transformação - Transition toward deeper knowledge

cords.name: Corda Azul
cords.meaning: O Mar (The Sea) - Signifies consciousness of the immense path ahead to travel

cords.name: Corda Azul-Verde
cords.meaning: Transformação - Deepening commitment to the art

cords.name: Corda Verde
cords.meaning: A Floresta (The Forest) - Represents one of the lungs of the world. This graduation concentrates all the work and solidifies learning. From this graduation comes the continuation and foundation of ABADÁ

cords.name: Corda Verde-Roxa
cords.meaning: Transformação - Preparing for teaching responsibilities

cords.name: Corda Roxa
cords.meaning: A Ametista (Amethyst) - Reflects the continuity of capoeira. The capoeirista seeks to overcome physical, psychological, and spiritual challenges in pursuit of capoeira knowledge and defense of ABADÁ's ideals

cords.name: Corda Roxa-Marrom
cords.meaning: Transformação - Advancing toward professorship

cords.name: Corda Marrom
cords.meaning: O Camaleão (The Chameleon) - The cord that characterizes the ABADÁ style. From this graduation will come the future Mestrandos, Mestres, and Grão-Mestres of ABADÁ

cords.name: Corda Marrom-Vermelha
cords.meaning: Transformação - Advancing toward mastery

cords.name: Corda Vermelha
cords.meaning: O Rubi (Ruby) - The stone that symbolizes justice. The capoeirista acquires consciousness of the responsibility they have toward capoeira, seeking to conduct their work and decisions with justice

cords.name: Corda Vermelha-Branca
cords.meaning: Transformação - The capoeirista can develop their full potential to understand and maintain ABADÁ's ideals, preparing to assume the maximum graduation. This requires precision, honesty, loyalty, and above all, wisdom and impartiality

cords.name: Corda Branca
cords.meaning: O Diamante (Diamond) - The mineral that reflects all colors and is the hardest gemstone. The Grão Mestre works to preserve the true ideals. In white, all colors unite. Through wisdom, patience, humility, loyalty, and firmness of purpose, they maintain the philosophy, tradition, and foundations. There is only one Grão Mestre in ABADÁ, who has the greatest responsibility of guiding the destiny of the organization
